column1: Congratulations to @FGCU on being recognized as the top university in Florida for entrepreneurial studies. #FlyEaglesFly https://t.co/9f4UROVag1

- that is how our system of government works. We have more that unite us than divide us and now that the heat of battle has drawn to a close we must come together for the betterment of all our citizens. (2/2)

Congratulations to Pres-elect Biden on a successful campaign. All Americans need to come together to support Pres-elect Biden. Our nation will only be successful if the new admin is. We must work together to enact bipartisan legislation & solve the problems our country faces 1/2

Another improvement would be to hold social media outlets responsible for their content like a newspaper. The ultimate answer is term limits; public service as a temporary duty rather than a career as the Founders intended. (4/4)
We must all work together to overcome America’s challenges. A return to balanced Congressional Districts would be big help. Let the general election not the primary detetmine representation. (3/4)
Likewise Democrats will hopefully realize that all this talk about socialism defunding police and supporting violence is a losing proposition. (2/4)

The election is a wake up call for America: to prosper Republicans need a message which appeals to college educated & suburban voters like we used to have & we need to lead on solutions for legal & orderly immigration and on the challenges presented by climate change. (1/4)

Congratulations to Judge Amy Coney Barrett on her confirmation as our newest Supreme Court Justice! I am confident that Justice Barrett will be a champion of Constitutional jurisprudence & maintain a professionalism & sound judicial temperament throughout her time on the Court.

This is a historic day for the Catholic Church as Pope Francis has appointed Archbishop Wilton Gregory to the position of Cardinal becoming the first  black bishop to accede to this position in the U.S. Cardinal Gregory will excel in his new role. https://t.co/Kt0Xw3eJoo

I am a strong believer in the principles of both judicial independence & due process for accused persons in all cases. I have recently read reports about the Uribe case that raise serious questions about whether due process has been followed in the investigation and in his arrest https://t.co/ghXqoLwnMb
Kathleen and I are hoping for a speedy and complete recovery  for the @POTUS and @FLOTUS at this time.

Pleased that @NOAA will award over $2.2 Million in grants to universities across the U.S. to combat the overwhelming threat that rising sea levels have on coastal communities. @FGCU will benefit due to their outstanding work in developing a coupled coastal & inland flooding model
She was a champion of women's rights and had a love of our country that was unchallenged. Her passion and opinions will remain with us throughout history. May she rest in peace. (2/2)

It is a sad day for our nation. Kathleen &  I offer our deepest sympathies on the passing of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg. The passing of Justice Ginsberg is a great loss for our highest court and for America. (1/2)

On this 19th anniversary of 9/11 we must #NeverForget the thousands of innocent lives we lost on that beautiful day in 2001 and we must continue to honor the brave first responders who saved lives and sacrificed their own. https://t.co/NqZzwCiujb

Continued U.S. efforts to strengthen rule of law and respect for democratic institutions in #El Salvador are critical to addressing the serious challenges facing the country. The U.S. must maintain its leadership in these efforts. https://t.co/wBeTfnPPA8

I hope that the Senate will now realize what the House of Representatives & Pres. Trump realize-that FL needs to be protected from offshore drilling-& act to convert this executive order into formal legislation like HR 205 so that it cannot be easily reversed by a future admin3/3

I've worked tirelessly to unite FL Congressional delegation on this issue pass legislation to permanently extend the moratorium in the EGOM & lobby this admin on the need to keep offshore drilling from being a potential danger to our economy ecology & military readiness2/3
By this Executive Order President Trump has taken an important action to protect Florida’s economy & ecology from the threat of offshore drilling. (1/3) https://t.co/W70VkMXAyk

As we celebrate the 75th anniversary of the end of the Second World War let us not forget the sacrifices our brave men and women of the American armed forces extended to free millions of innocent civilians across the globe from oppressive tyrannical governments.

This is truly an unworkable  idea and can only result in more disastrous policy. Defered amounts will either be forgiven or reimbursed by the federal government or worse employers will be required to pay them. (2/2)

The employee portion payroll tax deferal is a reckless idea that will put many employees in jeopardy for the deferred liability when it becomes due  since  they will have already spent the deferred amounts.  (1/2) https://t.co/E6UCbXS2n5

I am pleased to announce @marinesanctuary has received a grant from @NOAA to provide funding to the Clean Seas Florida Keys program. As a co-sponsor of the Save Our Seas Act I support grassroots efforts such as these to encourage communities to take action to clean our oceans

This is the wrong move especially at a time when we are beginning to see Covid cases falling and social distancing/mask wearing working. It is critical for people to be tested if they have come in contact with a Covid positive person. https://t.co/5jgPziMf1M

CNN you are better than this. What part of burning buildings rioting and shooting is peaceful? Now more than ever we need fair and honest journalism - and we need a return to law and order. https://t.co/polNZlS87i

China wasted no time silencing free speech in Hong Kong & arresting those such as Jimmy Lai that dissent from the communist message of Beijing. As I pointed out in my op-ed last month there are steps that can be taken to punish China for these actions. https://t.co/U8PzIIw3Wm
Today @POTUS signed the Great American Outdoors Act into law. This legislation which I cosponsored will provide our national parks with badly needed upgrades tourism development and wildlife refuges.

It is critical that we continue to build on the legacy of the USAGM and its subsidiaries as unbiased and nonpartisan voices of freedom democracy and human rights throughout the world. https://t.co/Zw3JRBKao0
Remote voting effectuates social distancing and follows proper health procedures. The work of Congress must continue but it need not put people at risk unnecessarily. (3/3)

Votes have been occurring remotely for several months now with no adverse consequences. Given the recent COVID-19 positive test results for my colleagues including Louie Gohmert today this method of voting is the prudent and rational course of action. (2/3)

As I have said before Congress should utilize modern technology to permit remote voting. While I wanted to proxy vote as soon as the Speaker set it up I agreed to wait until the lawsuit challenging its legality had been heard which has now happened. (1/3)

I am pleased to report that 5000 pythons have been removed from the Florida Everglades and surrounding regions by the @SFWMD @MyFWC and @NatlParkService. This is a significant milestone in the fight to remove these harmful animals. https://t.co/TYmWS3YSrc

The President’s executive order takes us one step closer in bringing prescription drug costs to a heel. I supported the End Price Gouging for Medications Act with this same goal in mind. Reigning in the pharmaceutical industry is long overdue. https://t.co/bOCZs2SYNc

Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Nayef  has worked constructively with the United States for many years and was instrumental in providing counter terrorism intel in the aftermath of 9/11. We need to know right now where he is and if he is safe. https://t.co/HdqFkkZsxY

I join @repsires in urging a transparent selection process for Guatemala’s judiciary in accordance with the rule of law. We should work w/Guatemala to strengthen their anti-corruption efforts. As they push for more direct foeign investment transparency & rule of law are critical https://t.co/2EwXWxcjxD
https://t.co/vuWVewzA35 (2/2)

@POTUS is right to push back on China’s hegemonic ambitions & abusive authoritarian practices & to call for reordering Western companies’ supply chains to reduce dependence on China. In the words of Lenin"The Capitalists will sell us the rope with which we will hang them"(1/2)

I strongly condemn the continued human rights abuses committed by the Castro regime in #Cuba. The Cuban people deserve access to independent information and the chance to speak freely without government repercussions. I continue to stand with them in their struggle for freedom. https://t.co/WQzxbBtOk4
This move will reflect that Poland is a reliable security partner for the United States and will strengthen U.S. military capability to respond to any Russian aggression in the Baltics. (2/2)

With news this month that the U.S. will begin to decrease its permanently stationed forces in Germany — I hope earnestly that @POTUS will discuss a potential positioning of significant U.S. military in Poland in his meeting today with Polish President Andrzej Duda. (1/2)
Kathleen and I would like to extend our thoughts and prayers for @RepAndyBarr and his family over the unexpected loss of his wife Carol.

I join my colleague @repsires in rejecting Maduro’s unconstitutional naming of a sham electoral council. We will continue to stand with @AsambleaVE and the Venezuelan people in demanding free and fair elections. https://t.co/K99aMiSvWl
Today is #Flagday. Please join me in celebrating our Nation’s Flag and in honoring those who fought to protect the rights and freedoms that it symbolizes. https://t.co/eFiSzcVwhp

Please join me in celebrating #worldoceansday. As an avid outdoorsman I am constantly reminded of how blessed we are to enjoy our oceans. We must continue to take significant steps to clean and preserve our oceans so future generations will also be able to share in their beauty
We must hold corrupt actors accountable for their crimes and demonstrate that the U.S. continues to support the fight against corruption in #Guatemala. https://t.co/WL513btXYb
This legislation will protect our intellectual property from theft by the Chinese government. Congress should pass the SHEET Act now. (2/2) https://t.co/fzS2plsQIc

Today @POTUS announced restrictions on Chinese graduate students in the United States – a decision that I support & one that both @tedcruz and I have addressed through the SHEET Act which we introduced in June 2019.  (1/2)

Florida’s Tax-Free Holiday for hurricane preparedness begins this Friday May 29th and runs through June 4th. Items such as batteries coolers flashlights generators radios and tarps will be available tax free. #BePrepared https://t.co/CcwkuYuYOu

Today astronauts Bob Behnken & Doug Hurley will reach for the stars as they take part in the first manned space flight from the U.S. in 9 years. In cooperation with NASA the Spacex’s Crew Dragon rocket will launch from the Kennedy Space Center at 4:33 PM https://t.co/2VO5WPDALY
Reinstating the Fairness Doctrine which served us well for 48 years would recreate a climate in which all sides of an issue are equally presented and heard https://t.co/NdHOdIOVzV

I’m deeply concerned the Ortega regime in #Nicaragua continues to cover up impact of COVID-19 within its borders. I urge full cooperation w/medical experts to mitigate the devastating effects of this virus & support the well-being of the Nicaraguan people https://t.co/GUPO91YAQF

Data clearly shows how normal modes of transp. contribute to carbon emissions. With social distancing in place carbon emissions have been reduced 17%. Moving forward we should enact a carbon tax at the source to lower output of these harmful chemicals https://t.co/bf5Nf9HjEM

Cong. should utilize all options for conducting business. Proxy/remote voting allows for distancing/following of proper health procedures. We have important work to do over the coming months & it cannot be delayed; however it isn’t necessary to put people at risk in the process

The House was right to pass H.Res. 967 to allow for proxy and remote voting on a temporary basis to ensure the safety of its members staff & support personnel that work within the Capitol Hill complex. We are still in the midst of a serious global pandemic. (1/2)

Welcome continued actions to hold the regime in #Cuba accountable for their destabilizing actions. We can’t stand by while they shelter terrorists responsible for violence in #Colombia harbor U.S. fugitives and continue to prop up the illegitimate #Maduro regime in #Venezuela https://t.co/0TOJZUwder

The vast majority of Florida’s people live on our coasts. We should not victimize our coastal economies by artificially holding water in Lake Okeechobee to supply an industry (Sugar) that is kept in business through government assistance. https://t.co/Y9GkDKsPdW

The Guyanese people deserve to have their voices heard through an efficient and transparent recount. While I welcome the ongoing process it is critical that the Government of #Guyana allow international representatives from @CarterCenter and @IRIGlobal to support it. https://t.co/Ud8y8kRyDx

75 years ago today the Supreme Allied Commander General Dwight D. Eisenhower accepted the unconditional surrender of German forces which ended military conflict in Europe.  I am grateful for the sacrifices our servicemen and women gave in order to defeat fascism and tyranny. https://t.co/sxnbeWTNvU
The EU “kowtows” emboldens China and threatens the world.  https://t.co/0A4tC6QyXE
What are these schools thinking? Tax them. They should return these funds immediately.  https://t.co/5U6DqLiGX3

It is encouraging to see this issue of Chinese infiltration gaining traction. @SenTedCruz and I sponsored the SHEET Act to address exactly this issue. It is time to pass this legislation in the House and Senate now. https://t.co/qJdFgPOvEO
This evidence proves clearly that co2/no2 emission reductions work. The EPA sould not be relaxing these standards. https://t.co/MnpOyFrU3W

Congress should get back to work on behalf of the American people when it can be done safely and securely. Right now remote or paired voting is the best safest alternative until the pandemic subsides and normal voting procedures can occur. https://t.co/QMDmLMlZvL

Typical-Maduro regime places 1 of its most corrupt & criminal officials in a critical leadership role as the economy collapses further amid the ongoing health crisis. The int’l community should soundly denounce this action & stand with the Venezuelan people in demanding democracy https://t.co/zck25wUtBc

Funds have now been replenished for the Paycheck Protection Program to aid our small business community. Please visit the SBA website linked here for information on PPP and other funding programs that are available. https://t.co/nIJnLuCTnL

The WHO along with most of the UN is overdue for a cultural overhaul; the United States must protect its interests in these organizations. Are we done with allowing the corrupt CCP to control information to and from the international community? https://t.co/l5N1MBJyPr

The postal service must adapt to changing markets. In 2019 the USPS lost over $8 billion dollars so COVID-19 is not the underlying problem for them. The USPS should adjust pricing eliminate o.t. adjust delivery schedules & eliminate subsidies to compete https://t.co/nNDafbGTd1

To limit future risk to lives to our economy &ecology the senate should pass my bill HR205 to make permanent the ban on drilling in the Eastern Gulf East of the Military Mission Line & the Interior Dept should stop undermining the post-Macondo well control regulations (2/2)

10 years ago today the Oil Rig Deepwater Horizon exploded  and a economic and ecological disaster ensued. This tragedy killed 11 crew members and caused over 200 Million gallons of oil to be spilled. (1/2) #DeepwaterHorizon

Close the national parks - save lives.  https://t.co/TDkuZNfgj1

Kathleen and I wish a happy and blessed Easter Sunday to all. Especially in these difficult days we find strength in our faith that we will defeat this deadly virus that plagues our Nation. https://t.co/nE7sHMt5WW

Tide Loads of Hope Powered by Tide Cleaners launched 4 new areas offering free laundry services to the families of front line responders.  The services are now available in Naples Ft. Myers Sarasota and Palm Beach County.   Visit https://t.co/czRhx3nBHT to learn more.

Today is #nationaldoctorsday - I could not be more appreciative of our doctors and health care providers as they put their own health and safety at risk during this global pandemic to help people in need.

Thank you @SpeakerPelosi for moving the CARES Act quickly and safely through the House of Representatives and for your work on this legislation. As Americans we must come together to defeat this virus. #Coronavirus

Any recount in Guyana must be fully transparent and adhere to electoral law. https://t.co/rYShO03R9a

Congratulations to @Almagro_OEA2015 on his re-election as Secretary General of the @OAS. I value his continued leadership on democracy and human rights in the Western Hemisphere and look forward to working with him to address the unprecedented challenges facing the region.

We are in a gobal pandemic-Congress should utilize modern technology to permit remote voting. Votes on spending & response to the pandemic are critical & will need quick action. Remote voting is a way to effectuate social distancing & follow proper health procedures #RemoteVote

In addition to introducing the SHEET Act with @SenTedCruz I last week sent a letter to the @FBI asking for information on what resources may be needed to combat foreign influence in the United States. (2/2) https://t.co/GCABbDG0CY
The United States must increase the resources we deploy to fight against subversive foreign influences at work in our country. (1/2)

Glad the NLRB published a new joint-employer rule to overturn the 2015 Obama NLRB decision which is grossly prejudicial to employers. By reinstating a long standing  interpretation local businesses will be re-empowered to create new jobs. https://t.co/wiRq4RxGhq

Reports of armed police and soldiers entering #ElSalvador’s National Assembly are deeply concerning. I urge all sides to come together in a peaceful and constructive manner to address the needs of the Salvadoran people.  https://t.co/UjuFJq0hDn

On this day in 1962 Pres. Kennedy expanded the embargo of goods to Cuba. Likewise the facilitation of 90% of #Venezuela’s oil production by #Russia about 400k bpd must be stopped whether through interdiction or embargo. (2/2)

This unjust imprisonment of US citizens by the #Maduro regime should be vigorously opposed by the US and our democratic partners. We must maintain pressure on the corrupt Maduro regime in order to facilitate a democratic transition in #Venezuela. (1/2) https://t.co/rwgr8BVQgS

Employees deserve a voice that is reflective of today’s rapidly modernizing workplace. Though I do not support the PRO Act I am proud to offer a pro-worker amendment that would improve this bill. (2/2)

Today I offered an amendment to the PRO Act to empower current union employees who are locked into old and outdated union contracts. In 2016 NLRB data showed that only 6% of union members voted to be represented by their union. (1/2)

As a proud father and grandfather I am committed to protecting the sanctity of human life starting at conception. I will continue fighting for the rights of the unborn. I am proud to support today’s #marchforlife2020 https://t.co/gpcc65v3ox
#PriceOnPollution https://t.co/1kBYAyCdN2
The new standard is a common sense return to the traditional legal framework that will empower our local businesses and give them the ability to create new jobs. https://t.co/auIntw7IAc
